intro: Agathophytum bonus-henricus, commonly known as the "blessed Henry's agate plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant features a compact, low-growing rosette of fleshy, blue-gray leaves that store water. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically appear in shades of yellow and white, adding visual interest. It is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
